basics.name: Zhongya Lin
basics.summary: A researcher in the field of physics, solid mechanics and mechanobiology, focusing on multiscale and viscoelasticity

work.name: IBDM & CNRS, Aix-Marseille University, Marseille, France
work.summary: Try to reveal the biophysical mechanisms behind the development of the fly wing.

work.name: Institute of Biomechanics and Medical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China
work.summary: Built biophysical models from tissue scale to subcellular scale.

publications.name: A Physics-Informed Neural Network Framework for Simulating Creep Buckling in Growing Viscoelastic Biological Tissues
publications.publisher: Computer Methods in Applied Mechanics and Engineering
publications.summary: It developed a physics-informed neural network framework for viscoelastic creep buckling and tissue growth morphological evolution without artificial perturbation.

publications.name: Adaptive Cytoskeletal Responses to Extracellular Environment Viscosity Modulate Cell Migration
publications.summary: It revealed the biophysical mechanisms of cell migration and migration memory in a viscous environment.

publications.name: Mechanobiological modeling of viscoelasticity in soft tissue growth and morphogenesis
publications.publisher: Journal of the Mechanics and Physics of Solids
publications.summary: It developed a mechanobiological model to characterize the viscoelasticity of growing tissue and its morphological evolution.

publications.name: A strain gradient linear viscoelasticity theory
publications.publisher: International Journal of Solids and Structures
publications.summary: It proposed a strain gradient viscoelasticity theory to capture the multiscale spatial effect and temporal effect.
